sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The US is warning the world could face Armageddon if Vladimir Putin uses tactical nuclear weapons to try and win his war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The first European Political Community Summit has come to a close as the EU and its neighbors look for ways to develop peace and prosperity in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Leaders of Azerbaijan, Turkey and Armenia meet at the European Political Community despite recent clashes in the Nagorno-Karabakh region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A stern warning from the US President.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The risk of a nuclear Armageddon is at its highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Biden says Russian President Vladimir Putin was not joking when he spoke of using tactical nuclear weapons after suffering setbacks in his war in Ukraine. Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky told an Australian think tank NATO should consider preventative strikes if Moscow decides to use nuclear weapons. In a sign of tension, Zelensky's press secretary later explained that the president meant preventative sanctions and not strikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: What should NATO do?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Eliminate the possibility of Russia using nuclear weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But above all, I again appeal to the international community, as did on the February 24th. Preventive strikes so Russia knows what will happen if they use them." The Kremlin has denounced Zelensky's comments. Putin has repeatedly alluded to using his country's vast nuclear arsenal, including last month when he announced plans to conscript Russian men to serve in Ukraine. He has also accused the West of engaging in nuclear blackmail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The newly established European political community met for its inaugural meeting on Thursday in the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Czech Republic. Its 44 members, represented by the heads of state, discussed ways to bring the EU and its neighbours closer together on issues like energy and infrastructure, especially in the light of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The gathering brought together many countries that do not always see eye to eye, like Armenia, Azerbaijan and Turkey, as well as EU members, EU hopefuls and the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Our common task was to create an informal platform where we can cooperate, share ideas, and develop solutions to return peace and prosperity to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And I think that we succeeded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So I think it's very useful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I do hope this is a new phase of our common relations, and this is the beginning of the day after.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But our willingness is clearly to engage, to have concrete projects and to work all together for the unity of our continent, especially in these very challenging times, and for the interests of our people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The assembly was addressed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who called for more military support and to boost sanctions against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European powers noticeably missing were Russia and Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The next EPC meeting will be hosted by Moldova.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thursday's European Political Community Summit brought together some heads of state

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: that would not usually be seen together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And unlikely talks between the Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdogan, the prime minister of Armenia Nikol Pashinyan, and the Azeri leader Ilham Aliyev did happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Recently renewed clashes between Armenia and Ankara's ally Azerbaijan have made relations between the states extremely difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Turkey and Armenia have not had diplomatic ties since the 90s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We don't have any preconditions whatsoever. We just said make sure the relations between you and Azerbaijan come to a certain level of maturity and make a peace agreement. As soon as you do this, there'll be no snag with us. If the doors are to be opened, we will open the doors and pave the way for all kinds of air, land and rail transport." Tensions were inflamed during the 2020 war over the Nagorno-Karabakh territory. A peace deal was brokered by Russia that year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The EU is also increasing efforts to find lasting peace in the region, but also wants to maintain a good relationship with Azerbaijan due to its strategic position as a supplier of fossil fuels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The British Prime Minister Liz Truss has refused to acknowledge any potential power blackouts within the UK, despite warnings from the National Grid Electricity System operator, the ESO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In an interview at the European Political Community Summit on Thursday, Truss said that her reason for attending the European gathering was to work on relations with partners in order to guarantee energy supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She also insisted that the UK could get through the winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, Britain's National Grid has said that planned three-hour blackouts could be imposed in some areas if gas supplies fall short of demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The body also added that the risk of temporary power cuts could be avoided with help from the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Last year, 43 per cent of Britain's electricity was provided by gas-fired power plants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However two gigawatts from coal-fired power plants are on standby in the event of a loss of imports from France, Belgium and the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The war in Ukraine and the ensuing sanctions on Russia have created an energy crisis across the continent, forcing some Western countries to seek out new sources of fossil fuels, putting pressure on their economies and citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One long-standing issue European leaders seem unable to solve is migration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, two tragic accidents saw at least 22 people dead and dozens missing after migrant boats sunk near Lesbos and Kithira.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nearly 100 others were saved, but what they experienced will stay with them forever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Three or something like two hours later, during these three and two hours, most of the women died, and then young guys and old men.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We couldn't do anything for them. We saw just how they died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The UN Refugee Agency says that there has been a shift in the type of migration, with desperate people taking more dangerous routes than five years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So the trend since 2015 has been a decrease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, in saying that, the journeys are becoming more dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are seeing the death toll climbing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In 2021, despite 120,000 arrivals, we saw about more than 3,200 people that were recorded dead or missing on those routes and in these journeys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So they are deadlier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Authorities say people with smugglers have changed routes in recent months to try and avoid heavily patrolled waters around Greek islands. The vessels, which might have traveled from neighboring Turkey, were hit by stormy weather.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The world's weather is interconnected, and this year's La Nina, a powerful weather pattern influenced by cooler temperatures over the Pacific Ocean,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: is making the prospect of extremely cold, dry weather this winter considerably more likely across the continent of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's all because of high air pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: While the temperature is going up everywhere on the globe, Central Asia will remain cold for Siberia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: of Central Asia will remain cold for climate B. So as soon as we start having easterlies, this Siberian air will move over Europe and will make temperature drop. That's the risk we're facing, especially at the beginning of the winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the temperature is increasing around the globe, La Nina's impact is being felt in different ways on different continents. In Australia, some of the wettest ever conditions have been recorded. And in western parts of North America, a drought like no other is being experienced. For Europe, La Nina's impact could mean extreme cold weather is just around the corner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are going to see these extremes. These extremes are going to get get worse certainly over you know our lifetimes um we we're going to have to expect to see um things get considerably more severe it comes at a time when gas shortages this winter are a real possibility for many european countries and for londoners eileen and michael o'keefe the timing could not be worse the cost of making a cup of tea has already tripled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There's only one more daunting period they can remember.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We got through the war and the rationing and we will get through it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But I think for the next six, eight, nine months, it's going to be very, very difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Weather is hard to predict, but the early data suggests the probability of an extremely cold winter is far higher than normal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 420 kilometres above the Atlantic and a day after blast-off,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: a SpaceX capsule has docked at the International Space Station and a fresh new crew for NASA has finally arrived.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The group of four includes the first Native American woman to orbit Earth and the first Russian to launch from the US in 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The new arrivals will replace four other astronauts who will return to Earth next week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Putin is unlikely to be receiving many birthday wishes from his fellow world leaders on his 70th birthday today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But a Russian pop artist has unveiled a portrait of the president on the eve of the Russian leader's big day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The painting called Putin with a puppy is a replica of a portrait painted by the artist ten years ago but this time it's twice as large.
